This App was created as a part of master thesis by Maciej Palmowski, a student on Warsaw University of Technology in Poland. 

This app allows users manipulate the codec of A2DP Profile which is used during a connection with a bluetooth audio device. Every codec delivers different level of audio quality, therefore switching the codec with this app, can bring you better experience while using your wireless audio device. 

On the main screen you are able to check currently active codec and its details such as sample rate or bits per sample, as they are displayed at the left top of the screen. The subjective level of quality is represented by the level of bar filling, which is positioned below. The level of bar filling for each codecs comes from interpreting the results of the research made with participants rating tracks that were simulated with mentioned codec. This research was also realised as another part of the master thesis. 

You are also able to change the codec automatically for the best one possible with your current wireless audio device by clicking the button at the bottom. Furthermore it is possible to change the codec for the specific one by clicking the frame containing the list of all supported codecs by your devices. 

You can learn about detailed codecs' specifications by checking the side bar menu that can be drawn out from the left side of the screen. 

Note that codecs' impact on the audio quality comes only with bluetooth audio transmission and doesn't apply to situation of using wire for audio listening.
